Of course. I've reviewed the current description for MVP-45 and will clean it up to align with our documentation standards. This will involve reorganizing the content into the standard `User Story`, `Acceptance Criteria`, `Technical Details`, and `Definition of Done` sections, while ensuring all the original information is preserved and presented more clearly.

Here is the updated description I will apply to the ticket:

```markdown
### User Story
As a database engineer, I need to implement triggers to automatically update the `updated_at` timestamp column on record modifications. This will ensure that we have an accurate audit trail for all data modifications, improving data integrity.

### Acceptance Criteria
*   A new database function, `update_updated_at_column()`, is created, which sets the `updated_at` column of the modified row to the current timestamp.
*   Database triggers are implemented on the `leagues`, `teams`, `rosters`, and `games` tables.
*   Each trigger fires before an `UPDATE` operation on its respective table.
*   When a record is updated in any of these tables, its `updated_at` column is automatically populated with the current timestamp.
*   The trigger implementation is verified through testing to work for various update scenarios.
*   The performance impact of the triggers is assessed and confirmed to be within acceptable limits.

### Technical Details

#### Function Definition
```sql
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION update_updated_at_column()
RETURNS TRIGGER AS $$
BEGIN
    NEW.updated_at = NOW();
    RETURN NEW;
END;
$$ language 'plpgsql';
```

#### Example Trigger
```sql
CREATE TRIGGER update_leagues_updated_at
    BEFORE UPDATE ON public.leagues
    FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION update_updated_at_column();
```
*Note: This trigger must be replicated for the `teams`, `rosters`, and `games` tables.*

### Dependencies
*   **Blocked by**: MVP-42 (Enable Row Level Security)
*   Completion of core table creation (Phases 1-4).

### Definition of Done
*   The `update_updated_at_column()` function has been successfully created and tested.
*   Triggers for `leagues`, `teams`, `rosters`, and `games` tables are implemented and fully functional.
*   All `Acceptance Criteria` have been met and verified.
```

I will now update the ticket.

User Story\n\nAs a database engineer, I need to implement triggers to automatically update the `updated_at` timestamp column on record modifications. This will ensure that we have an accurate audit trail for all data modifications, improving data integrity.\n\n### Acceptance Criteria\n\n* A new database function, `update_updated_at_column()`, is created, which sets the `updated_at` column of the modified row to the current timestamp.\n* Database triggers are implemented on the `leagues`, `teams`, `rosters`, and `games` tables.\n* Each trigger fires before an `UPDATE` operation on its respective table.\n* When a record is updated in any of these tables, its `updated_at` column is automatically populated with the current timestamp.\n* The trigger implementation is verified through testing to work for various update scenarios.\n* The performance impact of the triggers is assessed and confirmed to be within acceptable limits.\n\n### Technical Details\n\n#### Function Definition\n\n```sql\nCREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION update_updated_at_column()\nRETURNS TRIGGER AS $$\nBEGIN\n    NEW.updated_at = NOW();\n    RETURN NEW;\nEND;\n$$ language 'plpgsql';\n```\n\n#### Example Trigger\n\n```sql\nCREATE TRIGGER update_leagues_updated_at\n    BEFORE UPDATE ON public.leagues\n    FOR EACH ROW EXECUTE FUNCTION update_updated_at_column();\n```\n\n_Note: This trigger must be replicated for the_ `teams`, `rosters`, and `games` tables.\n\n### Dependencies\n\n* **Blocked by**: MVP-42 (Enable Row Level Technical Details\n\n```sql\nCREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION encrypt_token(token TEXT) \nRETURNS TEXT AS $$\nBEGIN\n  RETURN encode(encrypt(token::bytea, current_setting('app.encryption_key')::bytea, 'aes'), 'base64');\nEND;\n$$ LANGUAGE plpgsql SECURITY DEFINER;\n\nCREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION decrypt_token(encrypted_token TEXT) \nRETURNS TEXT AS $$\nBEGIN\n  RETURN \"Welcome back ðŸ‘‹ Josh\" (first name only)\n* Analytics view shows \"Hi, Welcome back ðŸ‘‹ Josh\" (personalized with first name)\n\n## Acceptance Criteria\n\n* App overview dashboard displays \"Welcome back ðŸ‘‹ \\[FirstName\\]\" instead of full display name\n* Analytics overview dashboard displays \"Hi, Welcome back ðŸ‘‹ \\[FirstName\\]\" instead of generic message\n* First name is extracted from authenticated user's displayName field\n* Solution handles edge cases (empty names, single names, extra whitespace)\n* Welcome messages use real authenticated user data via useAuthContext\n* No hard-coded names or demo data remain\n\n## Technical Details\n\nFiles to modify:\n\n* `src/sections/overview/app/view/overview-app-view.tsx`\n* `src/sections/overview/analytics/view/overview-analytics-view.tsx`\n\nKey Changes:\n\n1. Added getFirstName() helper function to both components\n2. Replaced user?.displayName with firstName variable\n3. Updated both app and analytics overview welcome messages\n4. Maintained existing authentication integration\n\n## Definition of Done\n\n* Dashboard welcome message shows first name only (e.g., \"Josh\" instead of \"Josh Yarber\")\n* Analytics welcome message is personalized with first name\n* Helper function handles various name formats correctly\n* No performance impact on dashboard load times\n* Works consistently across different user accounts\n* Code follows existing component patterns and conventions\n\n## Test Cases\n\n**Test Scenario 1: Standard Full Name**\n\n* Given: User displayName is \"John Smith\"\n* When: User views dashboard\n* Then: Welcome message shows \"Welcome back ðŸ‘‹ John\"\n\n**Test Scenario 2: Single Name**\n\n* Given: User displayName is \"Madonna\"\n* When: User views dashboard\n* Then: Welcome message shows \"Welcome back ðŸ‘‹ Madonna\"\n\n**Test Scenario 3: Empty/Missing Name**\n\n* Given: User displayName is empty or null\n* When: User views dashboard\n* Then: Welcome message shows \"Welcome back ðŸ‘‹\" (graceful fallback)\n\n**Test Scenario 4: Name with Extra Whitespace**\n\n* Given: User displayName is \"  Alice  Johnson  \"\n* When: User views dashboard\n* Then: Welcome message shows \"Welcome
